page.title: 02The Village of Tiptoe.
page.content: Tiptoe is a small village on the edge of the New Forest. It has one main road and several side roads. There are about 180 dwellings. There is a primary school. Mrs Coombes has been working in the Post Office for 9 years. She enjoys her job. She believes it is the only part time Post Office in the area opening from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. 6 days a week. They receive on average 2 parcels a week. 70 pensioners collect pensions and 30 parents collect child allowance each week. The most popular sale is stamps. Mrs Scott has been a parish councillor since 1979. She was voted on to the parish council. The meetings are held in Hordle. Nine councillors and a few members of the public usually attend the meetings.
